Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Obama "hasn't even come close" to cutting the deficit by half, when in fact the deficit has decreased but not by half.
Understate: The claim understates the progress made in reducing the deficit by not acknowledging that it has started to shrink.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that Obama has completely failed to deliver on his promise.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Obama's failure to cut the deficit by half is solely his responsibility, without considering external factors such as the depth of the recession.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for why the deficit was not cut by half, such as the impact of the recession on the economy.
